key_points: Vice President Kamala Harris emphasizes the importance of addressing the root causes of migration from Central America.
The U.S. has restarted engagement in Central America to address issues causing migration, under the Biden Administration.
The Root Causes Strategy is based on decades of experience and four core pieces of evidence.
Addressing root causes of migration is critical to the overall U.S. immigration effort, including reforming the immigration system.
Relief efforts alone, such as COVID-19 vaccines and hurricane relief, are insufficient to stem migration.
The U.S. aims to address corruption as a root cause, with plans to launch an Anticorruption Task Force.
Partnerships with other governments, international institutions, businesses, and civil society are crucial to the strategy.
Governments of Mexico, Japan, and Korea, along with the United Nations, have committed to join in providing relief to Central America.
The U.S. encourages private sector investment in the region to boost economic opportunity.
The Administration commits to a consistent engagement in the region, aiming to build on successful strategies and pivot away from ineffective ones.
